data.title: Cyclic groups
data.solution:
n = int(input())
c = input()
s = input().split()

s[0] = ""
s.sort()
g = [c * i for i in range(n)]

if s == g:
    print(n)
else:
    print(*[x for x in g if x not in s])
data.statement:
Given an integer <<n>> and a character <<c>>, we define a <<Group>> of size <<n>> generated by <<c>>  as the string set: <<0, c, c * 2, ... , c * (n - 1)>>. For example, <<0 a aa aaa>>, generated by the element {{a}}, is a Group of size {{4}}.

You are given an integer [[n]], a character [[c]] and a string [[s]], and you have to:

<<(1)>> If the string [[s]] represents a Group of size [[n]] generated by [[c]], just print its size. 
<<(2)>> If it isn't, print the <<NEEDED>> elements (ranged by string size) to make [[s]] a Group of size [[n]].

`Examples (the number n appears first):
3, 0 a aa   -> 3
3, 0 aa a   -> 3 (order is irrelevant)
4, 0 bbb b  -> bb (the only remaining for n = 4)
4, 0 c ccc  -> cc cccc
5, 0 c ccc  -> cc cccc ccccc`

testCases.title: 3. Not a group (2) val
testCases.testIn:
7
k
0 A kk kkk kkkk < kkkkkk

testCases.title: 5. Extra val
testCases.testIn:
5
Z
0 ZZ Z Y YY YYY YYYY YYYYY

data.constraints:
[[c]] can be any ascii character.
First character in [[s]] is always {{0}}.
0 < [[n]] < 10
data.stubGenerator:

read c:string(1)
read s:string(100)
write The size if it is a group, else the NEEDED elements
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> A positive integer [[n]]
<<Line 2:>> A character [[c]]
<<Line 3:>> A space separated string [[s]] representing the possible group to study.
data.outputDescription:
If [[s]] is a Group, it's size [[n]].
If [[s]] is not a Group, a string with the <<NEEDED>> elements ranged by string size.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Given an integer n and a character c, we define a Group of size n generated by c as the string set: 0, c, c * 2, ... , c * (n - 1). For example, 0 a aa aaa, generated by the element a, is a Group of size 4.

You are given an integer n, a character c and a string s, and you have to:

(1) If the string s represents a Group of size n generated by c, just print its size.
(2) If it isn't, print the NEEDED elements (ranged by string size) to make s a Group of size n.

Examples (the number n appears first):
3, 0 a aa   -> 3
3, 0 aa a   -> 3 (order is irrelevant)
4, 0 bbb b  -> bb (the only remaining for n = 4)
4, 0 c ccc  -> cc cccc
5, 0 c ccc  -> cc cccc ccccc
Input
Line 1: A positive integer n
Line 2: A character c
Line 3: A space separated string s representing the possible group to study.
Output
If s is a Group, it's size n.
If s is not a Group, a string with the NEEDED elements ranged by string size.
Constraints
c can be any ascii character.
First character in s is always 0.
0 < n < 10
Example
Input
3
a
0 a aa
Output
3
